crypto.name: CryptoGods
crypto.desc: This flag can be deciphered by using the tools brought to life by the renowned computer scientists Gottfried Leibniz and Bob Bemer. Submit it in the format ShaastraCTF{...} Flag.txt

crypto.name: Laplace Fourier and CNN
crypto.desc: Decrypt "cOgQdUrKiOrQjjHlNyIeG" and submit it in the format: ShaastraCTF{....}. This file is available for assistance: Encoder.py

crypto.name: Prime Decryption
crypto.desc: Decrypting this is not usually easy, but you see that the public key is only 24 bits long! You quickly collect the encrypted message and get to work...... Public Key: 14537813, 5. Get Cracking! Intercepted.txt

crypto.name: Twofold flipping
crypto.desc: Decrypting this file should give us the answer.... file.txt

forensic.name: Contest
forensic.desc: Shattered pieces of a puzzle found here: Event.zip

pwn.name: About Time
pwn.desc: Insider information says that the password is only composed of digits.... After figuring the password out, please submit the flag in the format - ShaastraCTF{...} timing.exe

pwn.name: Iterant
pwn.desc: Here lies a complicated recursion problem of which the answer needs to be found for the value of 250. How will you do this? Submit the answer in the format ShaastraCTF{...} fibbmod.cpp

pwn.name: OperationPWN
pwn.desc: Can you find the correct decimal numeber input to this program? Submit the flag as ShaastraCTF{...} main.asm

pwn.name: Snooping
pwn.desc: All we know of the suspicious ordeal is this that the password is a certificate in base64 format. Submit the flag in the format - ShaastraCTF{...} Snooping.pcapng

rev.name: Freezing Fire
rev.desc: We are going to play a childhood game with a twist! Grab on the hints and dive into nostalgia! Q12_Exec.zip

rev.name: MusicalMath
rev.desc: A piece of music is found at the crime scene, we need to decipher a password using this: MusicalMath.zip
